chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: The JSR-283 specification defines an API for a Content Repository (CR). The TYPO3 Content Repository aims to implement that in pure PHP.

section.title: Current Status
section.para:
The specification defines a very broad range of functionality, and currently only some parts of it are actually implemented. That includes:
creating and removing nodes
setting, updating and removing properties on nodes
node and property retrieveal by traversal
parts of the query object model for basic search operations
nodetypes can be registered and unregistered (only the nodetype name is recorded)
a backend for the FLOW3 persistence subpackage comes with the CR
Further features will be implemented a needed for FLOW3 and TYPO3 version 5, only later we will actively work towards JSR-283 compliance.
WebDAV access to the TYPO3 Content Repository will be provided by the seperate WebDAV package.
